page.title: 06WATER SUPPLY
page.content: Youlgrave water supply is one of the best in the country. The village gets its water from Blakeley Wood and Harthill springs. The water comes from gritstone and tastes nice when drawn from the tap. Youlgrave should never be without water unless the springs dry up which is very unlikely. In the centre of the village is the Fountain or Conduit Head. This is where water was first piped from the spring to the village in 1829. 5 taps were connected to parts of the village and this is where well dressings are held to thank God for our water supply. There is a water works committee and each house pays a rate (currently Â£33 p.a.) towards the cost of new pipes and repairs. New plastic pipes are being laid this year. A small amount of chlorine is added to the water. Daniel Bacon (9)
